page.title: 02GIRSBY _ THE OLD ESTATE.
page.content: Set in the best wooded part of area, 1 mile from Ludford, served by very minor road linking A631 Market Rasen to Louth road and the A157 Wragby to Louth road. An old Estate with Park_ land and the 'Big House'almost demolished but Park gates in wrought iron with running foxes heading pillars remain. Within the trees six Estate houses. Farmer based here has 325 acres of which 10 are Parkland used for permanent grazing and a further 70 acres are grassed in rotat_ _ion for grazing approx: 350 sheep with lambs in season. Remaining acres used for wheat, barley, oil seed rape & peas. 2 students employed. Woodland is ongoing task of thinning, felling, replanting _ main trees are Ash, Scots Pine, Sycamore and a few Beech. Pheasants reared for sport.
